definition: (coll.) father's older brother/uncle/term of respect for older man
big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother

sentences.english: The driver hastens next handlebar grandpa uprear, apologize again and again.
sentences.chinese: 司机赶忙下车把老大爷扶起，并连连道歉。

sentences.english: He went to the clinic to get some drugs for free.
sentences.chinese: 唐大爷去了趟卫生所，拿了些药，药是免费的。

sentences.english: You classmate is your big uncle?
Uncle Wang, who lives next door, accidentally saved a nautilus.
sentences.chinese: 隔壁的王大爷居然无意中救了一只鹦鹉螺。

sentences.english: Sometimes a few old man to get on the car, we all rob the seats.
sentences.chinese: 不时有几个老大爷上车，我们大家都抢着让座。

sentences.english: The children hung about Grandpa Wang, hoping to hear a story.
sentences.chinese: 孩子们围着王大爷，想听他讲个故事。

sentences.english: Just then an old man entered, supported by a boy.
sentences.chinese: 就在这时候，一个男孩搀着一位老大爷走了进来。

sentences.english: The young man gave up his seat to an old man.
sentences.chinese: 那年青人将座位让给一位老大爷。

sentences.english: Uncle Wang ran on, airing his views about the cases.
sentences.chinese: 王大爷滔滔不绝地谈着，发表对这案件的看法。

sentences.english: Grandpa Wang, who leads a frugal life, donated ten thousand yuan to poor children.
sentences.chinese: 一向俭约的王大爷为贫困儿童捐献了一万元。

sentences.english: Grandpa Wan grew painfully aware that the family were divided in their attitude.
sentences.chinese: 万大爷痛苦地意识到一家人的看法有分歧。

sentences.english: After attending evening classes Grandpa became more open-minded.
sentences.chinese: 老大爷上夜校以后，脑筋更开通了。

sentences.english: Who the two uncle told me NOKIA can hit the black walnut, now.
sentences.chinese: 谁他二大爷的告诉我诺基亚能砸核桃，现在黑屏了。

sentences.english: Grandpa, can I have a drink?
sentences.chinese: 老大爷，能给我口水喝么？

sentences.english: There is an old man under that tree.
Are you related to Uncle Xu of our village?
sentences.chinese: 你和我们村的徐大爷是亲戚吗？

definition: (coll.) father's father's mother/paternal great-grandmother/respectful form of address for an old woman
old man/I (an old man referring to himself)
eldest of father's younger brothers/uncle (term used to address a man about the age of one's father)
father's elder brother's wife/aunt (affectionate term for an elderly woman)
uncle (polite form of address for older male)
maternal aunt/step-mother/childcare worker/nursemaid/woman of similar age to one's parents (term of address used by child)/CL:個|个[ge4]
erhua variant of 老伴[lao3 ban4]
(of an elderly couple) husband or wife
